text: You know, you..

...really didn't have to
take me to the airport.

Oh, please.
Every moment is precious.

You know, besides,
somebody had to ride

in that other taxi
with the rest of your luggage

and your friends
don't seem to care very much
that you're leaving.

Well, we're not
really that close.

Okay, so, I guess this is,
uh, you know..

- Goodbye, then.
- Oh, no!
No, it's not goodbye.

I'm not leaving
until you get on that plane.

Okay, well, I guess
just...wait here then.

Hi. I need
a fake ticket to Yemen.

- One ticket to Yemen?
- Oh, no, no.

No, no, no. I just need,
I just need a pretend ticket.

I-I'm sorry, sir.
I don't understand.

Okay, what would you give
to a kid if he wanted
a ticket to play with?
Are you traveling with a child?
No.
Alright, look, you know what?

She's gonna think that
I'm handing you a credit card
but what I'm really gonna do
is hand you a library card.

Uh, sir, a ticket
to Yemen is $2100.
And we don't take library cards.

What's the matter?
Is something wrong?
Do you have to stay?
American Express?

(woman on PA)
'This is the final
boarding call'
'for flight 664 to Yemen.'
Well, I guess I got to go.
Oh, my Bing-a-ling.
I'll wait for you.

Do you even know
how long you're gonna be gone?
Well, just until we find

an energy source
to replace fuel.
Oh.
Well, I'll write you every day.
Fifteen, Yemen Road, Yemen.
Okay, goodbye.
Goodbye.

- Chandler?
- Nope.
Chandler!

Janice, there you are.
There you are.

I had to have
one last kiss and also..

...also you said
you were gonna leave

right after
I got on the plane.
No, no.
I-I wanna see you take off.

Well, then I guess
I'm going to Yemen.
I'm going to Yemen.

When we get to Yemen,
can I stay with you?
